name: bowtie2
description:
Bowtie 2 is an ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning
sequencing reads to long reference sequences

dependencies.name: readline
dependencies.description:
The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by
applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed
in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library
includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered
command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform
csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: simde
dependencies.description:
The SIMDe header-only library provides fast, portable implementations of
SIMD intrinsics on hardware which doesn't natively support them, such as
calling SSE functions on ARM. There is no performance penalty if the
hardware supports the native implementation (e.g., SSE/AVX runs at full
speed on x86, NEON on ARM, etc.).

dependent_to.name: bismark
dependent_to.description:
A tool to map bisulfite converted sequence reads and determine cytosine
methylation states

dependent_to.name: py-unicycler
dependent_to.description:
Unicycler is an assembly pipeline for bacterial genomes. It can assemble
Illumina-only read sets where it functions as a SPAdes-optimiser. It can
also assembly long-read-only sets (PacBio or Nanopore) where it runs a
miniasm+Racon pipeline. For the best possible assemblies, give it both
Illumina reads and long reads, and it will conduct a hybrid assembly.

dependent_to.name: rsem
dependent_to.description:
RSEM is a software package for estimating gene and isoform expression
levels from RNA-Seq data.

dependent_to.name: hic-pro
dependent_to.description:
HiC-Pro is a package designed to process Hi-C data, from raw fastq files
(paired-end Illumina data) to the normalized contact maps

dependent_to.name: fastq-screen
dependent_to.description:
FastQ Screen allows you to screen a library of sequences in FastQ format
against a set of sequence databases so you can see if the composition of
the library matches with what you expect.

dependent_to.name: sparta
dependent_to.description:
small RNA-PARE Target Analyzer (sPARTA) is a tool which utilizes high-
throughput sequencing to profile genome-wide cleavage products.

dependent_to.name: py-haphpipe
dependent_to.description:
HAplotype and PHylodynamics pipeline for viral assembly, population
genetics, and phylodynamics.

dependent_to.name: trinity
dependent_to.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.
